meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by belief in or worship of multiple gods.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization had a polytheistical belief system, worshipping various gods for different aspects of life.
meanings.sent2: The festival celebrated the polytheistical traditions of the culture, honoring a pantheon of deities.
meanings.sent3: The polytheistical statues in the temple seemed to have lively conversations when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a polytheistical battleground, torn between conflicting beliefs and values.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tapestries depicted a polytheistical paradise, where gods and goddesses coexisted harmoniously.

meanings.sent1: The polytheistical priest led the ceremonies with great reverence for the multiple gods.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her polytheistical views, believing in the existence of many divine beings.
meanings.sent3: The polytheistical debate at the forum sparked interesting discussions among the attendees.
meanings.sent4: His polytheistical nature made him open to exploring different spiritual paths and traditions.
meanings.sent5: The polytheistical artwork beautifully depicted the diverse pantheon of gods worshipped in the region.
